paper.title: Bank Green Credit Risk Assessment and Management by Mobile Computing and Machine Learning Neural Network under the Efficient Wireless Communication
paper.abstract: The study is aimed at assessing and managing the green credit risk of banks, reduces the systemic risk in the financial industry, and improves the efficiency of the use of bank funds. With the development and evolution of efficient wireless data communication and transmission technology, the study combines theoretical and empirical green credit analysis to analyze listed companies in different industries quantitatively. The index system of credit risk assessment is established through wireless data transmission technology combined with mobile computing and machine learning neural networks. A back-propagation neural network (BPNN) model is confirmed by principal component analysis and factor analysis, and the performance of the model is verified with example data. The results show that the BPNN-based credit risk assessment model can provide 95% accuracy. In addition, 99% of the sample companies have low risk and no green credit risk. However, most companies in the coal industry are at greater risk. Overall, medium and high-risk companies accounted for 11.5%. Compared with other state-of-the-art models, the machine learning neural network adopted here has better data fitting and prediction accuracy, higher learning efficiency, and higher accuracy. The model established inefficient wireless communication is suitable for bank credit risk assessment and has good reference value and practical significance for bank credit risk assessment and management in different industries.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用机器学习神经网络（特别是BPNN）来评估和管理银行的绿色信贷风险，这直接属于金融风险管理的范畴。论文明确提到建立信用风险评估指标体系，并通过模型验证其准确性，旨在降低金融行业的系统性风险。
